topic.title: Setting an Indent Size to Zero

Set indent to zero in Text Mode

body.p: will automatically format and indent documents at certain times. This includes indenting the content from the margin to reflect its structure. In some cases, you may not want your content indented. To avoid your content being indented, you can set an indent size of zero. Changing the indent size does not override the rules that uses for handling whitespace when formatting and indenting XML documents. Therefore, changing the indent size will have no effect on elements that require whitespaces to be maintained.There are two cases to consider.

dlentry.dt: Maintaining zero indent in documents with zero indent

dd.p: If you have existing documents with zero indent and you want to maintain a zero indent when editing or formatting those documents:

will examine the indent of each document as it is opened and if the indent is zero for all lines, or for nearly all lines, a zero indent will be used when formatting and indenting the document. Otherwise, will use the indent closest to what it detects in the document.

dlentry.dt: Enforcing zero indent for all documents

dd.p: If you want all documents to be formatted with zero indent, regardless of their current indenting:
All documents will be formatted and indented with an indent of zero.
dd.note: Setting the indent size to zero can change the meaning of some file types, such as Python source files.
